this is being executed by the runner so what's nice about this is you can have
multiple jobs executing in parallel and another runner can then just pick up the
job so because it's a go binary it means you can install it on any platform Linux
Mac Windows or basically anywhere that will compile a go binary or any anywhere
that supports docker you can run a git lab runner so you can have multiple
runners and they can go and pick up jobs but the other nice thing about this architecture is that runners can be auto
scaling and so by using auto scaling and this uses doctor machine so any cloud
platform or any system that you would build that uses your machine you could even do this with
anywhere that uses doctor machine you could have essentially a bastion runner that will then spin up additional
runners to pick up more jobs so for example we know a lot of organizations
everybody does their their bi-weekly sprint and then the Thursday before
Friday when they need to do their sprint demos everybody commits their code at four o'clock on a Thursday and wants
that to run through CI so that auto-scaling runner can just spin up a ton of runners to take care of all those
jobs that nobody's waiting in a queue but even better than having one runner
that spins up additional BMC on digital ocean is our kubernetes executors and so
when you install a gitlab runner inside your kubernetes cluster and you can use a helmet art to do that that gitlab
